pages.title: ⍟ Two of Pentacles ⍟
pages.text: Spirit of Harmonious Change$(br)   ♃ Jupiter in ♑ Capricorn

A young person, in the act of juggling, has a pentacle in either hand, and they are joined by that endless cord which is like the symbol of Infinity.$(br)  Behind them, ships endure the troubled sea, flowing with the turbulence.$(br)  The cord symbolizes the infinite movement of nature's fixed laws; the two pentacles, the duality of manifest force in a state of play that overcomes rigid definition.$(br)  What was once on the left

hand can be now on the right hand, and vice-versa; their paths change course, yet the movement and exchange in between are eternal. $(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Balance, exchange of energy, movement between different kinds of work.$(br)  Agitation, embroilment.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Imbalance, fake enjoyment. Search for literal meaning.$(br)  The need to focus your
energy on one task, or one area of your life, even if this means letting other things go.
